metadata.Description: Enhanced energy recovery refers to technologies or processes that increase the efficiency of energy recovery from waste or other sources.

level 1.Description: Enhanced energy recovery addresses waste management by utilizing waste as a resource for energy generation.
Enhanced energy recovery employs anaerobic digestion technology to convert organic waste into biogas for energy production.
Enhanced energy recovery collaborates with municipalities to establish waste-to-energy facilities and promote sustainable waste management practices.
Enhanced energy recovery supports the transition to a circular economy by reducing waste and maximizing resource utilization through energy recovery.
Enhanced energy recovery administers a feed-in tariff program to incentivize the generation of renewable energy from waste.
Enhanced energy recovery measures biogas production to assess the efficiency and effectiveness of anaerobic digestion processes.
Enhanced energy recovery aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals by promoting sustainable waste management and renewable energy generation.
Enhanced energy recovery is an instance of a circular economy solution that maximizes resource utilization and reduces environmental impact.

level 2.Subject: biodigestion
level 2.Description: Biodigestion addresses waste management challenges by converting organic waste into biogas and organic fertilizers.

level 2.Subject: biodigestion
level 2.Description: Biodigestion employs anaerobic digestion processes to break down organic waste and produce biogas.

level 2.Subject: circular economy
level 2.Description: The circular economy implements sustainable production practices that minimize waste and maximize resource efficiency.

level 2.Subject: circular economy
level 2.Description: The circular economy funds the development and implementation of innovative recycling technologies to promote a closed-loop system.

level 3.Subject: biodigestion
level 3.Description: Biodigestion addresses waste management challenges by converting organic waste into biogas and organic fertilizers.

level 3.Subject: circular economy
level 3.Description: The circular economy implements sustainable production practices that minimize waste and maximize resource efficiency.

level 3.Subject: traditional energy technologies
level 3.Description: Traditional energy technologies implement the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
